name: clouduseraccounts
title: Cloud User Accounts API
description: Creates and manages users and groups for accessing Google Compute Engine virtual machines.

parameters.name: userIp
parameters.desc: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.desc: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

parameters.name: key
parameters.desc: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

parameters.name: oauth_token
parameters.desc: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

parameters.name: prettyPrint
parameters.desc: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

parameters.name: quotaUser
parameters.desc: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

fields.name: description
fields.desc: An optional textual description of the resource; provided by the client when the resource is created.

fields.name: groups
fields.desc: [Output Only] A list of URLs to Group resources who contain the user. Users are only members of groups in the same project.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: [Output Only] Unique identifier for the resource; defined by the server.

fields.name: publicKeys
fields.desc: [Output Only] Public keys that this user may use to login.

fields.name: selfLink
fields.desc: [Output Only] Server defined URL for the resource.

fields.name: creationTimestamp
fields.desc: [Output Only] Creation timestamp in RFC3339 text format.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: [Output Only] Type of the resource. Always clouduseraccounts#user for users.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: Name of the resource; provided by the client when the resource is created.

fields.name: owner
fields.desc: Email address of account's owner. This account will be validated to make sure it exists. The email can belong to any domain, but it must be tied to a Google account.

schemas.name: AuthorizedKeysView
schemas.desc: A list of authorized public keys for a user account.

fields.name: keys
fields.desc: [Output Only] The list of authorized public keys in SSH format.

fields.name: sudoer
fields.desc: [Output Only] Whether the user has the ability to elevate on the instance that requested the authorized keys.

schemas.name: LinuxAccountViews
schemas.desc: A list of all Linux accounts for this project. This API is only used by Compute Engine virtual machines to get information about user accounts for a project or instance. Linux resources are read-only views into users and groups managed by the Compute Engine Accounts API.

fields.name: groupViews
fields.desc: [Output Only] A list of all groups within a project.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: [Output Only] Type of the resource. Always clouduseraccounts#linuxAccountViews for Linux resources.

fields.name: userViews
fields.desc: [Output Only] A list of all users within a project.

fields.name: resource
fields.desc: [Output Only] A list of authorized public keys for a user.

fields.name: resource
fields.desc: [Output Only] A list of authorized user accounts and groups.

schemas.name: LinuxUserView
schemas.desc: A detailed view of a Linux user account.

fields.name: homeDirectory
fields.desc: [Output Only] The path to the home directory for this account.

fields.name: shell
fields.desc: [Output Only] The path to the login shell for this account.

fields.name: uid
fields.desc: [Output Only] User ID.

fields.name: username
fields.desc: [Output Only] The username of the account.

fields.name: gecos
fields.desc: [Output Only] The GECOS (user information) entry for this account.

fields.name: gid
fields.desc: [Output Only] User's default group ID.

schemas.name: Operation
schemas.desc: An Operation resource, used to manage asynchronous API requests.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: [Output Only] The unique identifier for the resource. This identifier is defined by the server.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: [Output Only] Name of the resource.

fields.name: operationType
fields.desc: [Output Only] The type of operation, such as insert, update, or delete, and so on.

fields.name: region
fields.desc: [Output Only] The URL of the region where the operation resides. Only available when performing regional operations.

fields.name: selfLink
fields.desc: [Output Only] Server-defined URL for the resource.

fields.name: startTime
fields.desc: [Output Only] The time that this operation was started by the server. This value is in RFC3339 text format.

fields.name: endTime
fields.desc: [Output Only] The time that this operation was completed. This value is in RFC3339 text format.

fields.name: httpErrorMessage
fields.desc: [Output Only] If the operation fails, this field contains the HTTP error message that was returned, such as NOT FOUND.

fields.name: status
fields.desc: [Output Only] The status of the operation, which can be one of the following: PENDING, RUNNING, or DONE.

fields.name: targetId
fields.desc: [Output Only] The unique target ID, which identifies a specific incarnation of the target resource.

fields.name: progress
fields.desc: [Output Only] An optional progress indicator that ranges from 0 to 100. There is no requirement that this be linear or support any granularity of operations. This should not be used to guess when the operation will be complete. This number should monotonically increase as the operation progresses.

fields.name: clientOperationId
fields.desc: [Output Only] Reserved for future use.

fields.name: insertTime
fields.desc: [Output Only] The time that this operation was requested. This value is in RFC3339 text format.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: [Output Only] Type of the resource. Always compute#operation for Operation resources.

fields.name: statusMessage
fields.desc: [Output Only] An optional textual description of the current status of the operation.

fields.name: user
fields.desc: [Output Only] User who requested the operation, for example: user@example.com.

fields.name: description
fields.desc: [Output Only] A textual description of the operation, which is set when the operation is created.

fields.name: httpErrorStatusCode
fields.desc: [Output Only] If the operation fails, this field contains the HTTP error status code that was returned. For example, a 404 means the resource was not found.

fields.name: targetLink
fields.desc: [Output Only] The URL of the resource that the operation modifies.

fields.name: warnings
fields.desc: [Output Only] If warning messages are generated during processing of the operation, this field will be populated.

fields.name: data
fields.desc:
[Output Only] Metadata about this warning in key: value format. For example:
"data": [ { "key": "scope", "value": "zones/us-east1-d" }

fields.name: key
fields.desc: [Output Only] A key that provides more detail on the warning being returned. For example, for warnings where there are no results in a list request for a particular zone, this key might be scope and the key value might be the zone name. Other examples might be a key indicating a deprecated resource and a suggested replacement, or a warning about invalid network settings (for example, if an instance attempts to perform IP forwarding but is not enabled for IP forwarding).

fields.name: value
fields.desc: [Output Only] A warning data value corresponding to the key.

fields.name: message
fields.desc: [Output Only] A human-readable description of the warning code.

fields.name: code
fields.desc: [Output Only] A warning code, if applicable. For example, Compute Engine returns NO_RESULTS_ON_PAGE if there are no results in the response.

fields.name: zone
fields.desc: [Output Only] The URL of the zone where the operation resides. Only available when performing per-zone operations.

fields.name: creationTimestamp
fields.desc: [Output Only] Creation timestamp in RFC3339 text format.

fields.name: error
fields.desc: [Output Only] If errors are generated during processing of the operation, this field will be populated.

fields.name: errors
fields.desc: [Output Only] The array of errors encountered while processing this operation.

fields.name: code
fields.desc: [Output Only] The error type identifier for this error.

fields.name: location
fields.desc: [Output Only] Indicates the field in the request that caused the error. This property is optional.

fields.name: message
fields.desc: [Output Only] An optional, human-readable error message.

schemas.name: PublicKey
schemas.desc: A public key for authenticating to guests.

fields.name: creationTimestamp
fields.desc: [Output Only] Creation timestamp in RFC3339 text format.

fields.name: description
fields.desc: An optional textual description of the resource; provided by the client when the resource is created.

fields.name: expirationTimestamp
fields.desc: Optional expiration timestamp. If provided, the timestamp must be in RFC3339 text format. If not provided, the public key never expires.

fields.name: fingerprint
fields.desc: [Output Only] The fingerprint of the key is defined by RFC4716 to be the MD5 digest of the public key.

fields.name: key
fields.desc: Public key text in SSH format, defined by RFC4253 section 6.6.

pathParams.name: operation
pathParams.desc: Name of the Operations resource to delete.

pathParams.name: operation
pathParams.desc: Name of the Operations resource to return.

methods.name: list
methods.desc: Retrieves the list of operation resources contained within the specified project.

optinalQueryParams.name: maxResults
optinalQueryParams.desc: The maximum number of results per page that should be returned. If the number of available results is larger than maxResults, Compute Engine returns a nextPageToken that can be used to get the next page of results in subsequent list requests.

optinalQueryParams.name: orderBy
optinalQueryParams.desc:
Sorts list results by a certain order. By default, results are returned in alphanumerical order based on the resource name.

You can also sort results in descending order based on the creation timestamp using orderBy="creationTimestamp desc". This sorts results based on the creationTimestamp field in reverse chronological order (newest result first). Use this to sort resources like operations so that the newest operation is returned first.

Currently, only sorting by name or creationTimestamp desc is supported.

optinalQueryParams.name: pageToken
optinalQueryParams.desc: Specifies a page token to use. Set pageToken to the nextPageToken returned by a previous list request to get the next page of results.

optinalQueryParams.name: filter
optinalQueryParams.desc:
Sets a filter expression for filtering listed resources, in the form filter={expression}. Your {expression} must be in the format: field_name comparison_string literal_string.

The field_name is the name of the field you want to compare. Only atomic field types are supported (string, number, boolean). The comparison_string must be either eq (equals) or ne (not equals). The literal_string is the string value to filter to. The literal value must be valid for the type of field you are filtering by (string, number, boolean). For string fields, the literal value is interpreted as a regular expression using RE2 syntax. The literal value must match the entire field.

For example, to filter for instances that do not have a name of example-instance, you would use filter=name ne example-instance.

Compute Engine Beta API Only: If you use filtering in the Beta API, you can also filter on nested fields. For example, you could filter on instances that have set the scheduling.automaticRestart field to true. In particular, use filtering on nested fields to take advantage of instance labels to organize and filter results based on label values.

The Beta API also supports filtering on multiple expressions by providing each separate expression within parentheses. For example, (scheduling.automaticRestart eq true) (zone eq us-central1-f). Multiple expressions are treated as AND expressions, meaning that resources must match all expressions to pass the filters.

methods.name: removeMember
methods.desc: Removes users from the specified group.

methods.desc: Adds users to the specified group.

methods.name: insert

methods.name: list
methods.desc: Retrieves the list of groups contained within the specified project.

methods.name: getAuthorizedKeysView
methods.desc: Returns a list of authorized public keys for a specific user account.

pathParams.desc: Name of the zone for this request.

pathParams.name: user
pathParams.desc: The user account for which you want to get a list of authorized public keys.

requiredQueryParams.desc: The fully-qualified URL of the virtual machine requesting the view.

optinalQueryParams.name: login
optinalQueryParams.desc: Whether the view was requested as part of a user-initiated login.
